title: Francesca Schiavone
summary: Francesca Schiavone (Italian pronunciation: [franˈtʃeska skjaˈvoːne];[1][2] born 23 June 1980) is a retired Italian tennis player. She turned professional in 1998 and won the 2010 French Open singles title, becoming the first Italian woman to win a Grand Slam event in singles. She was also runner-up at the 2011 French Open. Her career-high ranking is world No. 4, achieved on 31 January 2011. To date, Schiavone is the last one-handed-backhand player to win a Grand Slam title on the women's tour.[3][4]
